<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Object[] array = (Object[]) o;
for (Object each : array) {
    System.out.println(each);
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can cast the object to an array and then iterate over it using a for-each loop.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: if (o != null && o.getClass().isArray()) {
  int length = Array.getLength(o);
  for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
    Object element = Array.get(o, i);
    System.out.println(element);
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: To iterate over an array, you can use the Array.getLength() method to get the length of the array and then use a for loop to iterate over each element by using the Array.get() method.

}
